meanings.definition: Crackies (noun): Small, crispy snacks often eaten as a snack.
meanings.sent1: I love munching on crackies while watching TV.
meanings.sent2: The kids enjoyed the crackies at the party.
meanings.sent3: The crackies in the bowl disappeared in no time!
meanings.sent4: The crackies crunched like autumn leaves underfoot.
meanings.sent5: The crackies were like tiny edible clouds of joy.

meanings.definition: Crackies (adjective): Describing something that is crunchy or crispy in texture.
meanings.sent1: The crackies cereal was my favorite breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The crackies sound of the leaves under our feet was satisfying.
meanings.sent3: The crackies toast was so crispy it almost crackled.
meanings.sent4: The crackies texture of the chips made them irresistible.
meanings.sent5: The crackies apple had a satisfying crunch with every bite.

meanings.definition: Crackies (verb): To make a cracking sound.
meanings.sent1: The fire crackies in the fireplace on a cold night.
meanings.sent2: The old floorboards crackies under our weight.
meanings.sent3: The ice crackies as we stepped on it, making us giggle.
meanings.sent4: The thunder crackies loudly, startling the birds.
meanings.sent5: The branches crackies in the wind, creating a soothing rhythm.
